resume.workfield: I am currently working as a CTO for Orion
resume.description: I have been working in the web industry for 10 years. I am hands-on and have grown different products for entities (startups, companies, charities and public) from MVP to acquisition or handover. I worked on B2C, B2B and Back-office web applications. I thrive in fast paced products environments, and am keen on being user centric.
resume.content.experiences.title: Experiences
resume.content.experiences.current.title: CTO @ Orion - Beta.gouv.fr
resume.content.experiences.current.produ: We leverage French Open Data to analyze students outcome in vocational education and derive impact KPIs for the training programs they completed. We allowed the needs of vocational high schools to emerge through their principals and built a workflow upon it to shape the vocational training offer in coherence with national ambitions (Ministries, Directorate General for School Education).
resume.content.experiences.current.myRol: I am in charge of the technical team, contractors and delivery. I am also responsible for the technical solution handover to the National Ministery of Education after incubation within beta.gouv.
resume.content.experiences.current.tasks: I co-plan budget (1.4M) and bi-anual roadmaps
I contributed to steering and funding comitees with stakeholders
resume.content.experiences.past.0.title: Tech Lead @ Seekube
resume.content.experiences.past.0.produc: We enabled online job datings for public & private universities. We aimed at building a smooth process for both organizers (schools) and participants (companies and students). Unsurprisingly the product user base grew a lot during COVID.
resume.content.experiences.past.0.myRole: I was responsible for the technical team processes during a period of significant user and client growth (x10 in 1,5 years) and driving the product handover following the acquisition.
Writing of technical and functional specifications
UI & API development, functional and unit testing
On-premise ops migration into auto-scalling cloud solution
Dev, staging and prod env creation and monitoring
Data flow opening with internal and external application
Defining and following technical roadmap objectives
Defining product roadmap with sales, tech, support and product teams
Setting work processes from idea to maintenance with tech, support and product teams
Managing and hiring a distributed technical team from 2 to 6 people
Tech results presentations during all hands meetings

resume.content.experiences.past.2.produc: We aimed at facilitating the life of real estate agents by providing a full white-label web-app for their workflow.
resume.content.experiences.past.2.myRole: I redesigned the applicative architecture behind an outdated IT system for real estate agents, proposed a technical solution, and delivered a MVP.

projects.title: My projects
projects.description: Here are the personal projects in an active state. Not that I'm working on it everyday, but those I'm coming back from time to time.
projects.mtts.title: Mtts
projects.mtts.description: Deterministic API to manipulate music theory concepts
projects.corsica.title: Corsica
projects.corsica.description: Tool to merge and analyse GPX (XML path coordinates storage system)
projects.cooler.title: Cooler
projects.cooler.description: Tool to present color matching based on Wada Sanzo | A Dictionary of Color Combinations and data from https://sanzo-wada.dmbk.io/

mtts.pages.index.subtitle: Music theory in Typescript

mtts.pages.index.experiments.1.title: Metronome
mtts.pages.index.experiments.1.descripti: A simple metronome based on ToneJS and webworkers
mtts.pages.index.research.title: Research
mtts.pages.index.research.text: I'm aiming to find new ways to create, teach, learn and discover music theory through experiments. This lab is based on MTTS Library (from my github) and Tonejs.

corsica.components.nav.title: Corsica
corsica.components.nav.subtitle: GPX manipulation & analysis tool
corsica.components.nav.actions.merge.des: Merge multiple GPX files to create a new one and upload it on any website to anlayse (Strava, Komoot, etc.)
corsica.components.nav.actions.analyse.d: Analyse GPX file and get a map, crude data on speed and altitude.
corsica.pages.merge.title: Merge GPX files
corsica.pages.merge.fileInputRequired: You have to specify at least two GPX files
corsica.pages.merge.fileInputDescription: Drag and drop your GPX files here
corsica.pages.merge.description: You select a few activites in a GPX format and I will merge them into one. You will then be able to analyse it with the analyse tool or any other tool (Strava, Komoot, etc.)
corsica.pages.merge.inputLabel: Specify a name for your merged GPX activity
corsica.pages.merge.inputRequired: You have to specify an activity name
corsica.pages.analyse.title: Analyse GPX file
corsica.pages.analyse.fileInputLabel: Upload the GPX file you want to analyse
corsica.pages.analyse.fileInputDescripti: Drag and drop your GPX file here
corsica.pages.analyse.description: This tool allows you to import a GPX activity file and get a crude Strava like dashboard to analyse it. No file is ever stored.
corsica.pages.analyse.subtitle: {date}
corsica.pages.analyse.selectAFile: Alternatively you can use the files I saved for demo purposes. You can select one, nothing bad will happen :
